info.dashboard: Overview of all WCAG accessibility checks you have run. Use "New Scan" to check a single page or an entire domain.
info.dashboardStats: Scans: number of checks run. Errors/Warnings/Notices: total accessibility issues found (errors = critical, warnings = medium, notices = hints).
info.scanHistory: List of your single-page scans. Each entry links to the detailed result view with issues, screenshot and metrics.
info.domainHistory: List of your domain (deep) scans. A domain scan crawls many pages of a site and shows systemic issues.
info.scanPage: Enter a URL and run an automated WCAG check. You can test a single page (immediate) or an entire domain (background).
info.scanConfig: URL: the page or site to check. Standard: WCAG level (A, AA or AAA). Engines: which tools run (axe-core, HTML CodeSniffer).
info.singleTab: Analyzes exactly one page immediately. Best for quick checks and detailed single-page results including screenshot.
info.deepTab: Crawls the whole domain in the background. Finds recurring issues across many pages.
info.standard: WCAG 2.x level: A = minimum, AA = recommended for most sites, AAA = highest. Choose based on your compliance target.
info.engines: axe-core and HTML CodeSniffer are established accessibility engines. Using both gives broad coverage.
info.settings: Profile, language, appearance, password and default settings for new scans.
info.profile: Name, email and optional details. The selected language applies to the whole UI.
info.appearance: Accent colour for sidebar and buttons. Affects look only, not functionality.
info.password: Change your password. You must enter your current password and confirm the new one twice.
info.session: Sign out from this device. Your scan data remains on the server.
info.scanConfigSettings: These values are used as defaults when you start a new single-page scan (WCAG level and engines).
info.about: CHECKION uses pa11y and axe-core for WCAG checks and is based on the MSQDX Design System.
info.developers: REST API for accessibility checks: integrate into CI/CD, build custom dashboards or use the micro-tools programmatically.
info.microTools: Utility endpoints: contrast ratio, readability (Flesch-Kincaid), and content extraction by selector.
info.scanData: Trigger scans and fetch results. GET = list, POST = new scan, DELETE = remove a result.
info.domainScan: A domain scan crawls your site in the background and can check unlimited pages without timeout.
info.liveProgress: Shows the progress of the running domain scan and the URLs currently being scanned.
info.scanResult: Detailed result of a single-page scan: issues found, WCAG levels, screenshot and metrics.
info.score: Overall accessibility score (0–100). Higher means fewer issues found.
info.severityTabs: Filter by severity: all issues, only errors (critical), warnings, notices, or passed rules.
info.domainResult: Result of a domain scan: aggregated issues across all pages, UX/SEO/structure and systemic issues.
info.domainScore: Score for the whole domain, based on all scanned pages.
info.systemicIssues: Issues that appear on many pages. Fixing one rule improves accessibility on all affected pages.
info.scannedPages: List of all pages scanned in this domain scan. Click to open individual results.
